title: [Large-scale] Comparison of Programming Learning Pathways: Course Design for CS Majors vs. Non-Majors

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental programming concepts and problem-solving skills
context.additional_context: Real-time code writing, execution, and analysis in a simulated environment, with BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) learning progression. Includes collaborative problem-solving activities using VR

learning_goals: Learners can diagnose their programming learning progress on a weekly basis through process-oriented assessment.
Learners can quantitatively evaluate their code quality using code metric analysis.
Learners can compare learning path differences between CS/mathematics majors and establish self-directed learning strategies.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
